div1.p: You'll be pleased to know that you are fondly remembered as one of the elven who attended "the first monthly roundup" of the Chicago Corral of The Westerners. It was at the Winnetka home of Elmo Scott Watson, February 25, 1944!
Because of this--and for many, many more reasons!--you've been selected for the first personality sketch in the BUCKSKIN BULLETIN. And I have the job of writing it!

So I'd appreciate a letter from you, John. Tell what you remember of those early days in association with Elmo Scott Watson et al. (Remember how years later we bumped into each other at the K.O. airport--both buying postcards!) One of my most vivid recollections of you in the earlier days is seeing and hearing you perform as leader of a Victory Celebration at Pine Ridge, circa 1945. Joan and I were driving through, unaware there was to be anything special there. Curiosity beat when I say you at the mike! Later the wounded veterans showed their bandaged limbs while squaws keened and a line-up of people gave them presents. And that night you and I chatted till midnight at our quaters in the agency...you telling me about the Ogalallas.
Maybe you'd like to reminiscexxx, too, about why you saw counterparts of Greek heroes in the great Western explorers...how you "discovered" Jedediah Smith...and "dreamed" where his adventures ended.
To top it all off, an inscribed photo (action or potrait) would be welcome! I await your letter!!

closer.note: P.S. Here's a piece on history of The Westerners I did for the new Western Historical Quaterly. Dr. Egerman was very appreciative of the print I finally found of you and Black Elk, which I took at Pine Ridge that time. --ldc
